heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 was 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 07 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (196°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.0°C) and outside temperature (down 3.7°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 8 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 2.3°C) and feels like temperature (up 4.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 490.1m higher than yesterday, 353.2m higher than the past week, 404.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 1181m to 2400m and averaged 2090m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and very bright daylight. Weather could become unsettled.
